sip_features.sip_feature:
HTML

RTL Updates:

  • PCR 57101 implemented: PSMI test feature implemented to block the arbiter from letting messages progress from the ingress port to the egress port.
  • Moved arbitration databus switch logic into the arbiter. Arbiter is completely in the power gated domain now. Should save on a lot of unnecessary isolation and save some power for the SOC.
  • Updated power state-machine to check that the PGCB lock request was low before checking the ports. Fixes a problem if PGCB is used w/o retention.
  • Updated POK handling to go into the port idle conditions. This will allow ports to be POK from the beginning without keeping the router from power/trunk clock gating.
  • Wrapper now unconditionally implements fscan_ret_ctrl to avoid collage errors when connecting the IOSF_DFX::SCAN interface.
  • Mapfile now has a slot for scan muxes.
  • Lintra waivers added to the source code.
  • Configuration signals placed at the top, these should match with what was in the old releases without synchronizers as they are static inputs out of reset.

Dynamo/Collage Updates:

  • Consistency Checks have been implemented to give users eairly indicators about bad configurations.
  • Multicast groups using ranges no longer break multicasting in the generated RTL.
  • Workspace is no longer required to be workspace and can be reconfigured.
  • Moved from Collage 2.1.p9 to Collage 2.1.p10
  • Supporting async-to-async router-to-router connections

Backend Updates:

  • UPF with isolation enabled works correctly with BXT configurations. (Synthesis, ATPG and LEC)
  • Added support for questCDC v10.2b
  • Moved to Zircon 1.6
  • LEC runs in hierarchical compare to shorten runtimes

Validation Updates:

  • Updated ACE model name updated to sbr_config_ipxact_[workspacename]
  • Router scoreboard now supports Dynamic Powergating
  • PSMI support added to the testbench by integrating OOB VC(PSMI_VC)
  • PSMI tests added to verify PSMI feature
  • PSMI interface assertions added

Functional Coverage: 96%

Line Coverage: 97%

sip_knissues.sip_knissue:
HTML
  • DC version G-2012.06-SP2 for one of the BXT routers is core Dumping. Still investigating, using G-2012.06-SP5 and it is working fine

sip_speccons.sip_speccon:
HTML

Integration Notes:

  • NOTE: that the Sideband Router map file needs to be updated to replace generic library cells.
